distros.name: Linux Mint
distros.description: Been here for quite a while. Community-driven, stable and familiar. Features the Cinnamon desktop environment. Works well even on 10-15 years old computers designed for Windows 8/10/11.

distros.name: Kubuntu
distros.description: A well established and trusted distro, based on Ubuntu with the KDE Plasma desktop environment. Similar requirements to Linux Mint.

distros.name: Zorin OS
distros.description: A polished distro focused on visual appeal, featuring the Gnome desktop environment with many out-of-the-box layouts, including a Windows-like one. Similar requirements to Linux Mint.

distros.name: Pop!_OS
distros.description: Built by System76, featuring the Cosmic desktop environment and focusing on usability.

distros.name: Aurora
distros.description: A user-friendly stable and immutable (making it harder to break) distro - the future of the Linux desktop. Features the KDE Plasma desktop environment.

distros.name: Fedora KDE
distros.description: Perfect environment for development and daily use with the KDE Plasma desktop environment.

distros.name: Fedora Workstation
distros.description: Perfect environment for development and daily use with the GNOME desktop environment.

distros.name: Bluefin
distros.description: Built on top of Fedora atomic, Bluefin is an immutable user-friendly distro, perfect for conteinerized development and daily use.

distros.name: Bazzite KDE
distros.description: A gaming-focused immutable Linux distribution, perfect for both PCs and handhelds, with a Windows-like layout.

distros.name: Bazzite GNOME
distros.description: A gaming-focused immutable Linux distribution, perfect for both PCs and handhelds.

distros.name: CachyOS
distros.description: An Arch-based distribution optimized for performance, featuring a Windows-like layout. Though not gaming-ready, it can be easily set up for gaming with just one meta package (cachyos-gaming-meta). The handheld edition, on the other hand, is gaming-ready. Good for development, too. Requires some terminal experience.

distros.name: Linux Lite
distros.description: A lightweight Linux distro with a sleek design. Minimum 1Gb of RAM is recommended. Good for slow computers or netbooks designed for Windows 7/8/10.

distros.name: Lubuntu
distros.description: A user-friendly lightweight Ubuntu variant, perfect for older hardware. Slightly lighter than Linux Lite due to using LXQt desktop environment instead of XFCE. Good for computers older than 15 years.

distros.name: antiX
distros.description: Even lighter alternative to Lubuntu, requires as minimum as 256Mb of RAM. Good for ancient computers.
